commenter_a: The British Empire and other European nations were not the only ones responsible for the suffering of blacks. For centuries, Arab and Berber traders made big profits from the highly lucrative 'business' of slavery. Millions of black Africans were captured/kidnapped from their homes, abused and sold in slave markets. Today, In places like Saudi Arabia and Qatar de facto slavery still exists. People from the Philippines, Indian subcontinent etc. live and 'work' there in subhuman conditions. This is not a history lesson. It is happening right here and now. None of this justifies in any way the crimes committed by European colonialism in general and the British Empire in particular against indigenous peoples. But I do hope Mr. Gayle (whom I respect) will not hesitate to write/speak about injustice and racism that still exist in other parts of the world - including in African and Arab nations - with the ...
post_message: Howard Gayle: "The education system told me nothing but lies about Africa."
